comment.author: 29350288@N06
comment._content: Although they looked rather similar, I'm guessing this is King Constantine I rather than his father King George I, which would date the image no earlier than March 1913.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Constantine I King of the Hellenes Constantine I was King of Greece from 1913 to 1917 and from 1920 to 1922. He was Commander-in-Chief of the Hellenic Army during the unsuccessful Greco-Turkish War of 1897 and led the Greek forces during the successful Balkan Wars of 1912-1913, in which Greece captured Thessaloniki, and doubled in area and population. He succeeded to the throne of Greece on 18 March 1913, following his father's assassination. --Wikipedia Also see: "King of Greece and family (LOC)" by Library of Congress

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Is the present Queen of Spain from this family?  I know she is Greek royalty.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: @ Cassies grandma -- Yes. The former king(s) are related to most of European royalty. King Constantine II's sister, Sophia, is married to King Juan Carlos of Spain (she was the former Princess Sophia of Greece and Denmark). BTW, King Constantine II of Greece and Queen Sofia of Spain are third cousins to Prince Charles of Great Britain. --Wikipedia

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: Thanks for that info.  I know I could have found it but was being lazy.  I am grateful you weren't!
